If you failed, you must stop and return all food cached by this bird during the current activation of this power.
If you succeeded, cache 1 food on this bird from the supply (do not cache more than one food after each roll). Then, if you have rolled fewer than 3 times during the current activation of this power, decide whether to roll again.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to copy the power of a bird that lets it move to another habitat---and this bird satisfies applicable conditions (e.g., being the rightmost bird in its habitat)---this bird may move to that habitat, even one in which it cannot be played.

When a bird (e.g., the Gray Catbird) repeats this bird's power, it repeats the copying power printed on this bird and not any powers this bird repeated earlier in the turn. Since being a predator power is a property of a power, this bird copying a predator power and the power succeeding counts as success of a predator power (e.g., for purposes of enabling the activation of a pink power on another player's mat, like that of the Black Vulture).

When this bird copies another bird's power, it retains any effects specified in the copied bird's power text as long as those effects may occur but not beyond the end of the turn. (So, e.g., if it copies the Coal Tit's power, it retains the ability to spend [seed] cached on this bird until the end of the turn but no longer, and if copies the Wood Duck's power, the copied power still obligates you to discard a card at the end of your turn.)

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to copy the power of a bird that lets it move to another habitat---and this bird satisfies applicable conditions (e.g., being the rightmost bird in its habitat)---this bird may move to that habitat, even one in which it cannot be played.
This bird counts towards Forester bonus card even though it can potentially fly elsewhere.

When a bird (e.g., the Gray Catbird) repeats this bird's power, it repeats the copying power printed on this bird and not any powers this bird repeated earlier in the turn. Since being a predator power is a property of a power, this bird copying a predator power and the power succeeding counts as success of a predator power (e.g., for purposes of enabling the activation of a pink power on another player's mat, like that of the Black Vulture).

When this bird copies another bird's power, it retains any effects specified in the copied bird's power text as long as those effects may occur but not beyond the end of the turn. (So, e.g., if it copies the Coal Tit's power, it retains the ability to spend [seed] cached on this bird until the end of the turn but no longer, and if copies the Wood Duck's power, the copied power still obligates you to discard a card at the end of your turn.)

Fan Art flavor text: Kala Clarke illustrated this bird using watercolor paint.
Note: If the additional bird has a “when played” power, it is triggered when the bird is played. If the extra bird has a “round end” power, it is triggered when the bird is played.

rulings.text: If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a teal power, you may resolve that power at any point among your other remaining teal powers.

additionalRulings.text: You may substitute 2 [wild] for any 1 food in a bird's food cost whenever you play a bird, including outside the scope of the "play a bird" action.

Power text: Reset the birdfeeder twice. Each time, cache all [invertebrate] rolled on this bird.
Flavor text: These sociable birds use their spiky tails as props while scratching to uncover insects.

Power text: All players may discard 1 [seed] from their supply to lay 1 [egg].
Flavor text: This bird is well camouflaged for feeding on open ground.
Note: If you discard a [seed] you may lay the [egg] on any bird not necessarily on the Zebra Dove itself.

additionalRulings.text: "Discarding" food while resolving a bird power counts as "spending".
Whenever you are entitled to gain resources, you may choose to take some but not all of the quantity specified.
